greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Full q-signature of n. Irregular triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the multiplicity of q(k) in the q-factorization of n.
comment: Every positive integer has a unique q-factorization (encoded by A324924) into factors q(i) = prime(i)/i, i > 0. For example:
Also the number of terminal subtrees with Matula-Goebel number k of the rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number n.
xref: The number whose full prime signature is the n-th row is A324922(n).
Matula-Goebel numbers: A007097, A061775, A109082, A317713.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 12 2019
